citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
Records show daily observation of 11 wild-caught voles on an approved protocol was completed by a Principal
Investigator(PI) in June 2022 through early September 2022. The PI failed to promptly notify the attending veterinarian
(AV) of unanticipated mortalities of eight of the 11 voles. Documents provided state 3 voles died in late July and the
remaining animals were found dead in August and early September. The AV was informed of the 9th vole death and
performed the necropsy which indicated that one animal had a bacterial lung infection. The lack of direct and timely
communication between the PI and the AV prevented the AV from intervening and evaluating the animals at an earlier
time point to minimize the number of vole deaths. The facility has taken corrective action to prevent recurrence.
Each research facility shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include daily observation of
all animals to assess their health and well-being; Provided, however, That daily observation of animals may be
accomplished by someone other than the attending veterinarian; and Provided, further, That a mechanism of direct and
frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and
well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
To be corrected by close of business 8/22/2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
